name: Brugmansia.1
description:
This piece opens my new series "Venenosa" of brazilian native&poisonous plants. 

Native in South America and in Brazil, the Brugmansia suaveolens (in Brazil, popular know as "angel's trumpet", "wizard's herb", "devil's breath" etc.) is a plant of the Solanaceae family, often used as entheogenic rituals and in tradicional medicine by native people. But, as the popular name "devil's breath" suggests, it can be very toxic (specially it seeds and leaves); so I strongly don't recomend the use if you don't really know and are habituated to the plant.
It has been described as "Datura suaveolens", an synonymy, but later Berchtold and Presl (1823) transfered the species to the Brugmansia genus.
It flowers have a notorious fragance that can be noted in the evening, it atract butterflies - which pollinates the pant.

ID: Brugmansia suaveolens

I'm a brazilian woman artist, you can find me at twitter by @ocvvvlta.
